intro: Nassauvia patagonica var. elatior, commonly known as the Patagonian nassauvia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It is often found in the Andes region, particularly in Argentina and Chile. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
